name: Branch Task End Tasks
description: Comprehensive pattern for handling end-of-branch tasks including quality checks, documentation updates, and release preparation.

context.when_to_use: When completing feature branches, preparing for merges, or finishing development milestones
trade_offs: May be overkill for small changes

steps: Fetch latest changes and tags from remote
Check existing version tags to determine next version
Analyze code changes for documentation impact
Create atomic commits with proper messages
Push changes and tags to remote

examples.name: Branch End Task Checklist
checklist: ✅ Existing tags checked and next version determined

code_templates.name: Branch End Script Template
code_templates.template:
#!/bin/bash
# Branch End Tasks for {branch_name}

# Fetch Latest
git fetch --all --tags

# Check Existing Tags
echo "Existing version tags:"
git tag --list | grep -E '^v[0-9]' | sort -V | tail -10

# Quality Checks
force-execute code-quality-check
force-execute security-analysis

# Documentation
force-execute docs-analysis
force-execute generate-docs-update-summary

# Release Preparation
force-execute check-release-readiness
force-execute generate-changelog

# Version Management
echo "Checking if version tag v{version} exists..."
if git tag --list | grep -q "^v{version}$"; then
  echo "Tag v{version} already exists. Please choose a different version."
  exit 1
fi
git tag -a v{version} -m "Release {version}"
git push origin v{version}
